column4: I know that the Ubuntu video drivers break suspend and hibernate, but does that happen to everybody? Is there anyone here who has the Nvidia driver AND can suspend/hibernate their computer?
never send a GUI to do a CLI job ;)
is he already in the CLI?
any such corruption could be fixed with fsck_ext2
that's not the problem
corruption can happen with journalling, it's just less likely. but if the corrupted bits are the journal bits, journalling ain't gonna save your bacon. :)
yes, but it makes it less likely, in the event of a hard shutdown.
it will, but it's dangerous
the reason visudo is good is because it prevents you from creating an unparseable sudoers. Unparseable sudoers = big problems
what's with the banning/d-lining-ness?
I'm just curious :)
not if he installed off a server CD ;)
how'd you guess?
not true, the algorithm it uses is fine, it was simply implemented in a very breakable way.

he may be, but that doesn't make you any less wrong... it's not a bad encryption algorithm, it's just a really insecure implementation that exposes the weaknesses in the encryption algorithm they did use
do you think major torrent releases run on top of uTorrent? i assure you Ubuntu doesn't. ;)
I mean as a client, not a server...
clients are servers with torrents
good point :)
the tracker is a wholly separate thing
I'm just saying that right now, one of the best GUI clients is uTorrent, and it runs nicely in Wine.
